translation_english: to think
example_sentence_english: I want to think calmly.

translation_english: thinking
example_sentence_english: I am thinking about the problem.

translation_english: thought (masculine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_italian: Il libro pensato ieri è interessante.
example_sentence_english: The book thought about yesterday is interesting.

translation_english: thought (feminine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_italian: La frase pensata da lei è chiara.
example_sentence_english: The sentence thought by her is clear.

translation_english: thought (masculine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: The details thought of were useful.

translation_english: thought (feminine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: The solutions thought of are valid.

translation_english: I think
example_sentence_english: I think about you often.

translation_english: you think
example_sentence_english: You think too much.

translation_english: he/she/it thinks
example_sentence_english: She thinks about the future.

translation_english: we think
example_sentence_english: We think the same thing.

translation_english: you (plural) think
example_sentence_english: You (plural) think of everything.

translation_english: they think
example_sentence_english: They think differently.

translation_english: I was thinking / I used to think
example_sentence_italian: Io pensavo spesso a quella idea.
example_sentence_english: I used to think about that idea often.

translation_english: you were thinking / you used to think
example_sentence_english: You thought it was easy.

translation_english: he/she/it was thinking / used to think
example_sentence_english: She was thinking about the past.

translation_english: we were thinking / we used to think
example_sentence_english: We used to think differently then.

translation_english: you (plural) were thinking / you used to think
example_sentence_english: You (plural) were planning to come.

translation_english: they were thinking / they used to think
example_sentence_english: They were thinking about other things.

translation_english: I have thought / I thought (masculine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_italian: Io ho pensato a quella idea.
example_sentence_english: I have thought about that idea.

translation_english: I have thought / I thought (feminine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: I have thought of the solution.

translation_english: you have thought / you thought (masculine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: You have thought about the problem.

translation_english: you have thought / you thought (feminine singular)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: You have thought of everything.

translation_english: she has thought / she thought
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject; also 'you (formal)'
example_sentence_english: Maria has thought about you.

translation_english: he has thought / he thought
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject; also 'you (formal)'
example_sentence_italian: Lui ha pensato a una soluzione.
example_sentence_english: He has thought of a solution.

translation_english: we have thought / we thought (masculine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_italian: Noi abbiamo pensato a un piano.
example_sentence_english: We have thought of a plan.

translation_english: we have thought / we thought (feminine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: We have thought of the alternatives.

translation_english: you (plural) have thought / you (plural) thought (masculine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: You (plural) have thought of everything.

translation_english: you (plural) have thought / you (plural) thought (feminine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: You (plural) have thought of the solutions.

translation_english: they have thought / they thought (masculine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_italian: Loro hanno pensato a un cambiamento.
example_sentence_english: They have thought about a change.

translation_english: they have thought / they thought (feminine plural)
notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; past participle normally does not agree with subject
example_sentence_english: They have thought about the options.
